venue.name: UNE Portland Campus WCHP Lecture Hall

item.description:
Join us for the latest season of our $1 Permaculture Movie Nights! An enriching and affordable way to pass a winter's evening with other members of our local permaculture group, these evenings begin with a brief potluck supper and are followed by a newish movie with relevance to ecological living, permaculture and resilience-building.  This year we will be running movie nights once a month, December through April.

Our December film will be "Anima Mundi: Permaculture, Peak Oil, Climate Change and the Soul of the World" (sounds ambitious for a film, yes?).  Anima Mundi is a new [ish] documentary on Permaculture, the Gaia theory, Peak Oil survival and Climate Change featuring David Holmgren (co-originator of Permaculture), John Seed (Deep Ecology), Dr Stephan Harding (Gaia Science and author of Animate Earth), Michael C Ruppert (from the movie Collapse), Michael Reynolds (from the film The Garbage Warrior), Noam Chomsky and Permablitz.  Watch a trailer here.  Running time is 1h 18 min.

6:30  Potluck supper (bring a dish to share and your potluck kit - dish/bowl/utensils/cup)

7:00 Announcement (bring any you have!) followed by the movie!

8:20 Brief De-brief and Closing....

The Resilience Hub & Portland Maine Permaculture would like to thank the University of New England Environmental Council for their continued support of this movie series.
item.how_to_find_us: WCHP Lecture Hall is in Parker Pavilion. Walk behind the church-like building on Stevens Avenue into a courtyard. It's no. 8 on this map: http://www.une.edu/admissions/tour/upload/pcmap.pdf Ok to park on campus!
